channel.title: Posts on Osama Sakhi
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Osama Sakhi

item.title: Speaking at TEDxGeorgiaTech's Fall 2018 Speaker Salon
item.description: In Fall 2018, I decided to apply to be a speaker for TEDxGeorgiaTech. I was chosen as one of the 6 speakers among 70 applicants. For the 6 weeks that followed, I rewrote my speech several times over, memorized for hours at a time, and struggled to master hand gestures and vocal intonations. Finally, on November 4th, 2018, my hard would paid. I was chosen to be the speaker that closed out the show.

item.title: Course Lineup 2018
item.description: In Fall 2018, he will be taking the following courses: Quantum Mechanics - CHEM 6495 Computer Vision - CS 6476 CSE Algorithms - CSE 6140 In Addition, I will be involved with the following: SUMO Challenge with Zhile Ren and Frank Dellaert TEDxGeorgiaTech as a Speaker

item.title: I Left My Job to Teach High-Schoolers at a Summer Camp, Here's What I Learned
item.description: In Summer 2018, I became an Instructor for two courses offered by Duke TIP: Applications, Algorithms, Computers: Modern Programming @ Rice University Artificial Intelligence @ Georgia Tech Through this experience, I learned to design courses end-to-end, including crafting syllabi, conducting lectures, creating assignments, & engaging in parent-teacher conferences.
